titles.title: Gaviota Coast Act of 1999
To direct the Secretary of the Interior to study the suitability and feasibility of including the Gaviota Coast of California in the National Park System.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to Department of the Interior for comments.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.

bill.summary: 5/5/1999--Introduced. Gaviota Coast Act of 1999 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to study and report to specified congressional committees on the suitability and feasibility of including in the National Park System the area of California known as the Gaviota Coast (extending generally from Coal Oil Point at Santa Barbara to Point Sal, California).
